passage: Author Madeline L'Engle, ______ blank to create a suspenseful tone that draws the reader in, begins her novel A Wrinkle in Time with descriptions of "wraithlike shadows" and "the frenzied lashing of the wind."
question_text: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

answer_rationales.D: Choice D is the best answer. The convention being tested is the use of verb forms within a sentence. The nonfinite present participle verb "looking" is correctly used to form a subordinate clause that describes the intent behind how L'Engle begins her novel.
answer_rationales.A: Choice A is incorrect because the finite past tense verb "looked" can't be used in this way to form a subordinate clause.
answer_rationales.B: Choice B is incorrect because the finite present tense verb "looks" can't be used in this way to form a subordinate clause.
answer_rationales.C: Choice C is incorrect because the finite present progressive tense verb "is looking" can't be used in this way to form a subordinate clause.
